newsitem.title: FINLAND: FORESTRY JITTERS KEEP HELSINKI FROM TESTING HIGHS.
newsitem.headline: FORESTRY JITTERS KEEP HELSINKI FROM TESTING HIGHS.

text.p: * Shares near year-highs on Wedneday but fail to test
stronger ground as forestries slip ahead of key results on
Thursday. Merita rallies on buy recommendations.
* HEX -0.08 pct at 2,222.17 adv-decl 43-40, 19 unch
* Vol FIM 420 mln, 22 pct in Nokia, 14 pct in Merita
Shares remained close to
year-highs but ended lively Wednesday session a shade lower as
forestries slipped ahead of UPM's and Metsa-Serla's eight-month
reports, brokers said.
"It depends on the UPM data whether forestries continue to
slide," one broker said. Shares in Europe's biggest forestry
group UPM-Kymmene lost 1.20 markka at 92.90 in cautious trade.
Merita advanced to 14.00 markka -- its highest since July
12, 1995 -- up 0.50 in brisk demand after buy recommendations.
Its competitor Okobank closed fair trade at 47.50 markka -- up
0.70 -- where it last traded on January 18, 1995.
The HEX set its calendar year-high 2,226.6 on October 8.
Pharmaceuticals wholesaler Tamro gained 0.50 markka to 32.50
ahead of eight-month data due on Thursday with volume boosted by
a 40 million markka in-house deal by Protos Stockbrokers. Protos
declined comment on the deal, and Tamro said it did not know who
traded the stock.
Engineering groups Rauma and Tampella also gained slightly
in moderate trade ahead of January-August reports.
Cargo shipping firm Finnlines rose 2.50 markka to 108.00,
its highest close since November 1995, as analysts said its
chance to up its BTL stake may justify a yet higher valuation.
Food and chemicals group Raisio returned to sharp gains,
ending up 16.00 markka at 279.00 after solid dealings ahead of
the group's update on its cholesterol-reducing Benecol margarine
on October 24.
-- Ilkka Virtanen, Helsinki newsroom +358-9-6805 0248
